page.title: 07HEALTH-HOSPITALS N.LEEDS.
page.content: MEANWOOD PARK HOSPITAL-was founded in 1929.It occupies a site of about 175 acres;5 acres are taken up with buildings,43 are woodland,16 are used for farming and the remainder form ornamental gardens and sports fields. The hospital can accommodate 450 mentally-handicapped patients who live in villas in the pleasant grounds.5 doctors,300 nurses,dentists,teachers, physiotherapists,gardeners and domestic workers are among the 500 staff occupied in patient care. The few resident children attend the adjacent Pennyfields school.For adults day and evening classes cover remedial education,arts and crafts,physical education and cookery.There is integration with the community including patients relatives,voluntary groups (religious and social) and the league of Hospital Friends.
